page.title: 03GARSWOOD RAILWAY STATION
page.content: Garswood Station was built in the 1840's. In those days the trains used to carry coal but nowadays they carry people.The station hasn't changed a lot over the years. It is very quiet and old fashioned. There are four people who work at the station,two relief workers and two station masters. They collect or sell tickets, clean the station and help people on and off the trains.The trains run to Liverpool or Wigan.The relief workers think it the nicest station in the area.There is a little vandalism in the station and someone commited suicide near the station.Forty four trains come in one day and three hundredand eight in a week,which makes about 16060 a year.All the workers wear a special uniform,which has just been issued. There are two waiting rooms.
